page.title: 16CHANGES IN CAISTOR SCHOOLS 1
page.content: A County Council 'Think Tank'visited the area in 1984 to discuss how best to reorganise education in light of falling rolls so that the schools were cost effective and maintained a wide, balanced curriculum.Discussions took place between Heads,Governors and staff and there were 2 public meetings in the town hall.From a variety of options,some of which suggested closing both secondary schools in Caistor,two were selected for further consideration: 1.Merge the two secondary schools to form one{comprehensive school. 2.Retain the two schools as at present but with{closer cooperation including sharing a common budget and resources. There were heated arguments in town regarding which option to adopt. CONTINUED ON PAGE 17.
